page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by the survey is that of the town of{BLYTH}in Northumberland. It is a town of some 40,000 inhabitants. Its history is based upon{Coal {Mining}with only one active colliery remaining and the{PORT.}Its growth as a port was directed by the coal mining industry with the export of "sea-coal" being complimented by imports of Scandinavian timber which were used as pit props. In the eastern part of the area lies the older section of the town with its nucleus of business and administration, whilst in the west lies the residential areas. {
